p: Climate change and health adaptation and vulnerability assessments are most helpful in planning for future risks to populations when they take into consideration future demographic, socioeconomic and health sector trends that may combine with climate drivers to either increase or reduce the resilience of health systems. The Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSPs) which were developed to help understand challenges to climate change adaptation and greenhouse gas mitigation activities under different futures are a useful tool for V&As [ 40].
